content.raw:
These velocity functions are only available for the `FreeJoint` type, so if the ability to set these velocities is important, then we may need to keep the requirement that the root joint is a `FreeJoint`, despite my prior comments.

On the other hand, if the ability to set these velocities can be considered optional, then we can just check if the root is a `FreeJoint` using a `dynamic_cast` and then put these function calls into an if-block that checks if the root is a `FreeJoint` while the earlier code that sets the root transform can use the more generic `Joint::setTransformFromParentBodyNode(~)`.
